intro: Melandrium brachypetalum var. tibetanum, commonly known as the Tibetan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
